p: Monarda punctata was collected from wild-growing plants near Newville, AL, USA (31°27′23″ N, 85°22′17″ W); the edge of a planted pine forest, disturbed grassland, full/partial sun, sandy-clay soil that had been intentionally burned (prescribed burn) 1.5 years before collection. The aerial parts of two different plants were collected on 1 June 2020.
